titleInfo.title: Transitional Child Care: State Experiences and Emerging Policies under the Family Support Act

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: CDF and the Center for Law and Social Policy (CLASP) jointly made this publication to provide insight into transitional child care policies and operations and to offer recommendations to policy makers and advocates. Transitional child care (TCC) is a new federal child care program that every state must have implemented by April 1, 1990. Established by the Family Support Act (FSA) of 1988, TCC is designed to help families that lose AFDC for income-related reasons to meet their child care needs for one year after AFDC ends.

name.namePart: Center for Law and Social Policy

mods.note: Collaborated with the Center for Law and Social Policy
